Name: Mobile energy storage systems with spatial–temporal flexibility for post-disaster recovery of power distribution systems: A bilevel optimization approach
Key ideas: Uses a bilevel optimization framework for post-disaster recovery using MESS. Top-level objective minimizes loadshed, while bottom-level minimizes the voltage angle.

Name: Resilient mobile energy storage resources-based microgrid formation considering power-transportation-information network interdependencies
Key ideas: Uses MESS and a rolling horizon framework to optimize loadshed recovery in a city-grid

Name: Application of Mobile Energy Storage for Enhancing Power Grid Resilience: A Review
Key ideas: Review of MESS use in disaster relief, sometimes combined with emergency generator usage

Name: Transportable energy storage assisted post-disaster restoration of distribution networks with renewable generations
Key ideas: Proposes a restorative framework that uses MESS to transport energy from areas disconnected from one another

Name: Home energy management system for enhancing grid resiliency in post-disaster recovery period using Electric Vehicle
Key ideas: Considers a framework that treats EVs as a distrubuted network of energy storage batteries, in order to prevent loadshed in individual households

Name: Research on optimal configuration of mobile energy storage in distribution networks considering various energy utilization efficiencies
Key ideas: Optimizes placement of MESS for urban grids,  develops adaptive decision-making frameworks under extreme disaster scenarios.

Name: Mobile Energy-Storage Technology in Power Grid: A Review of Models and Applications
Key ideas: Review of different MESS approaches, specifically for renewable energy grids where production is uncertain

Name: Distribution network restoration supply method considering 5G base station energy storage participation
Key ideas: Considers the problem of 5G stations backup power, when the grid capacity is volatile. Proposes a robust 2 stage to determine when is best to store and release energy.

Name: Optimal planning of mobile energy storage in active distribution network
Key ideas: Considers the usage of MESS to store and transport energy to take advantage of volatile renewable energy production to maximize annual revenue

Name: Increasing the resilience of the Texas power grid against extreme storms by hardening critical lines
Key ideas: Creates a model to minimize transmission line failures during hurricanes. Finds that hardening certain transmission lines by 1% can reduce probability of catastrophic outages by 5-20x in Texas grid during hurricane Harvey.

Name: Evaluation and Enhancement of Power System Resilience Under Weather Events
Key ideas: Review of different metrics used to quantify resilience of power grids during weather events

Name: Real-Time Power System Optimization Under Typhoon Weather Using the Smart Predict, Then Optimize Framework
Key ideas: Proposes real-time power system optimization using SPO. Predicts future line damage states in real-time during typhoons and dynamically adjusts optimization strategies.

Name: Resilience enhancement strategies for distribution networks considering the coordination of 5G base stations and multiple flexible resources
Key ideas: Considers using 5G substations as a distributed power-grid storage system, to increase resilience during weather events. Also considers MESS use. They formulate a model to minimize the economic cost of storage and the loadshed of the grid.

Name: Current Practices in Distribution Utility Resilience Planning for Hurricanes and Non-Winter Storms
Key ideas: Department of Energy document, review of best-practices for hurricane resilience.

Name: Stochastic dual dynamic programming for optimal power flow problems under uncertainty
Key ideas: Proposes a multistage AC OPF model, using a Markovian graph solved with SDDP. Also shows a deterministic SDP relaxation.

Name: Using Stochastic Dual Dynamic Programming to Solve the Multi-Stage Energy Management Problem in Microgrids
Key ideas: Applies SDDP to multi-stage energy management in microgrids with random energy prices and generation/demand.

Name: Batch learning SDDP for long-term hydrothermal planning
Key ideas: Applies batch learning techniques to SDDP in long-term hydrothermal planning. Reduces computational time while maintaining solution quality. Finds that this techniques improves parallel performance of SDDP, so it scales better than normal SDDP.

Name: Innovative Approaches to Stochastic Dual Dynamic Programming: Two-Period Decomposition and Parallelization in a Hydrothermal Scheduling Case Study
Journal: Journal of Water Resources Planning and Management
Key ideas: Uses SDDP to solve a hydrothermal problem, but uses two periods per subproblem

Name: Integration of energy storage systems and grid modernization for reliable urban power management toward future energy sustainability
Key ideas: Proposes using mini-storage solutions to enhance grid resilience, shows greater effiency

Name: A resilience-oriented optimal planning of energy storage systems in high renewable energy penetrated systems
Key ideas: Optimizes the placement of MESS in a grid with uncertain production & pricing, fixed battery storage, and possible shocks (hurricanes, etc.)

Name: Resilient resource allocations for multi-stage transportation-power distribution system operations in hurricanes
Key ideas: Uses a two-stage model, with the first stage taking care of allocating resources before the hurricane strikes, and the second stage being a multi-period model to minimize loadshed given the first stage allocations.

Name: Coordinated robust configuration of soft open point and energy storage systems for resilience enhancement of integrated multi-energy system at ports
Key ideas: Uses a two-stage robust model, where the first stage establishes a post-disaster "defense strategy" consisting of classifying sources by their flexibility and reserve capacity. The second stage minimizes loadshed based on the rankings from the first stage.

Name: A Multi-Stage Collaborative Optimization Operation Method for Distribution-Microgrid for Reliability Improvement
Key ideas: Multistage stage model: first stage places MESS, second stage certain corrective measures are taken and MES distribute power, third stage construction teams restore grid. Formulated as bi-linear MILP.

Name: A novel robust energy storage planning method for grids with wind power integration considering the impact of hurricanes
Key ideas: Robust multistage model, considers uncertainty in power generation from sources like wind. They develop a column and row generation algorithm.

Name: Multi-stage expansion planning of energy storage integrated soft open points considering tie-line reconstruction
Journal: Protection and Control of Modern Power Systems

Name: A multi-stage coordinated resilience enhancement strategy for distribution networks considering voltage quality
Journal: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
Key ideas: Develops a multistage model, where the first stage positions the MESS, and second and third stage coordinate restoration efforts to minimize loadshed and reduce voltage angle

Name: Enhancing resilience and sustainability of distribution networks by emergency operation of a truck-mounted mobile battery energy storage fleet
Key ideas: Considers multistage model to minimize distribution cost and loadshed, using MESS. Considers fluctuations in production from energy sources and disasters.

Name: Power System Transition Planning: An Industry-Aligned Framework for Long-Term Optimization
Key ideas: Proposes a multistage model for longterm planning with regards to transitioning from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources. Uses SDDP to plan around uncertainty

Name: On the Applications of Stochastic Dual Dynamic Programming
Key ideas: Survey on SDDP applications.

Name: Multistage operation for distributed solar and energy storage system
Key ideas: Multistage model using battery storage to generate income from time arbitrage

Name: State-of-the-art review on energy sharing and trading of resilient multi microgrids
Key ideas: Proposes the problem where many independent microgrids (eg. households with battery and solar) form together to coordinate their energy in and outflows. Challenge comes from significant correlation in energy generation

Name: A two-timescale operation strategy for battery storage in joint frequency and energy markets
Authors: Q Ma & W Wei & S Mei
Key ideas: Proposes a rolling horizon framework in energy trading, using batteries to perform time arbitrage to maximize revenue

Name: Certainty through uncertainty: Stochastic optimization of grid-integrated large-scale energy storage in Germany
Authors: LKK Maia & A Ochoa Bique & E Zondervan
Key ideas: Proposes a model for energy transition under uncertain generation capacity

Name: Routing and scheduling of smart mobile power banks for mobile charging and vehicle-to-grid services
Key ideas: Proposes a model to optimally route MESS to where is most nedded

Name: Rolling Horizon Robust Real-Time Economic Dispatch with Multi-Stage Dynamic Modeling
Key ideas: Proposes a multistage robust model for economic dispatch in power systems, with a rolling horizon. Develops a new "Robust dual dynamic program" method.

Name: A Two-Stage Robust Approach for Resilient Unit Commitment With Rail-Based Mobile Energy Storage Under Diffusional Uncertainties
Key ideas: Proposes a robust two stage model to minimize the worst-case operational cost of a rail network under the risk of hurricanes.

Name: Microgrids and resilience: A review
Key ideas: Review of different techniques to increase the resilience of microgrids under different kinds of problems (optimal formation, optimal scheduling and allocation)

Name: Data-Driven Stochastic-Robust Planning for Resilient Hydrogen-Electricity System with Progressive Hedging Decoupling
Key ideas: Uses multistage robust model to optimize against typhoons, using hydrogen as energy storage. First stage determines the "planning strategy", second stages identifies worst case scenario, and third stages optimally plans against this worst case scenario.

Name: A Multi Stage DRO-SDDP Approach for Planning Multi-Type Energy Storage Systems and Flexible Resources in High-Penetration Renewable Power Systems
Key ideas: Uses Energy storage systems (battery, pumped hydro, etc.) to smooth out the intra-day generation curve. Uses SDDP to optimize the planning of the grid, based on current uncertainty in production

Name: Dual stochastic dual dynamic programming for multi-stage economic dispatch with renewable energy and thermal energy storage
Key ideas: Uses a multistage model, solved with SDDP, to optimize the economic cost of dispatching energy in a power grid, using thermal energy sources

Name: Security-Constrained Multi-Stage Robust Dynamic Economic Dispatch with Bulk Storage
Key ideas: Proposes multistage robust model to optimize the economic dispatch against uncertain production and N-1 contigencies. Uses Benders decomposition to solve N-1 contigencies.

Name: A multi-stage risk-averse planning approach for multi-type ESSs considering Markov transition of persistent low output scenario
Journal: CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems
Key ideas: Proposes a multistage model to plan against the worst case scenario power generation of renewable energy systems (eg. long periods of low generation), using a Markov process

Name: Multi-Stage Stochastic Programming for Disaster Relief Logistics Under Forecast Uncertainty
Key ideas: Thesis on disaster relief under uncertainty. Showcases inventory and evacuation management during hurricanes, using SDDP and a rolling horizon framework.

Name: Energy Production and Storage Investments and Operation Planning Involving Variable Renewable Energy Sources A Two-stage Stochastic Optimization Model with Rolling Time Horizon and Random Stopping Time
Journal: Modern Optimization Methods for Decision Making Under Risk and Uncertainty
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon
Key ideas: Proposes a multistage model to optimize energy production and allocation against worst case extreme weather events

Name: Multi-time-step rolling optimization strategy for post-disaster emergency recovery in distribution system based on model predictive control
Journal: CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon
Key ideas: Proposes multistage rolling horizon framework in disaster recovery. Models against repair time, loadshed, and uncertain production, and optimizes expected economic loss due to loadshed

Name: A resilience-oriented multi-stage adaptive distribution system planning considering multiple extreme weather events
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon

Name: Towards Resilient Self-Proactive Distribution Grids Against Wildfires: A Dual Rolling Horizon-based Framework
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon
Key ideas: Multistage rolling horizon framework for restoration of power grid after a wildfire

Name: A multi-horizon stochastic programming model for long-term disaster housing logistics planning
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon
Key ideas: Proposes data-driven multi-horizon stochastic program for housing demand under extreme weather. Hedfes against short-term uncertainty and long-term logistics planning

Name: Resilient Preventive Scheduling for Hydrogen-Based Integrated Energy Systems Considering Impacts of Natural Disasters
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, Multistage, rolling horizon

Name: Optimal scheduling of a renewable energy-based park power system: a novel hybrid SDDP/MPC approach
Journal: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
Categories (e.g., SLO, ILO, Decision rul: disaster, Energy storage, SDDP, rolling horizon
Key ideas: Uses model predictive control to optimize power scheduling for a power system.

Name: Markov Chain–Based Policies for Multistage Stochastic Integer Linear Programming with an Application to Disaster Relief Logistics
Authors: M Castro & M Bodur & Y Song
Key ideas: Proposes a markov chain approximation to more efficiently solve Mixed State ILP, creating a 2 stage LDR

Name: Multistage stochastic programming with a random number of stages: Applications in hurricane disaster relief logistics planning
Key ideas: Proposes a logistics planning problem, where one needs to meet demand for relief items under a hurricane scenario. Considers hurricane's position as a markov chain. Novelty comes from addressing the fact that there is a random number of stages due to uncertain landing time.

Name: Multi-objective rolling horizon personnel routing and scheduling approach for natural disasters
Resilience enhancement for distribution system with multiple non-anticipative uncertainties based on multi-stage dynamic programming
Key ideas: Proposes multi-period DRO program to optimize against extreme weather events.
